intro: Lobelia boninensis, commonly known as the Bonin lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the Bonin Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to violet. The plant typically grows in coastal habitats, thriving in sandy or rocky soils. It has small, heart-shaped leaves and produces numerous flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
